content.text:
# List of international presidential trips made by Droupadi Murmu

This is a list of international presidential visits made by Droupadi Murmu since she became the President of India, following her election as president 25 July 2022.
Summary of international trips
As of  , Droupadi Murmu has made 8 international trips, visiting 15 countries. The first state visit was to United Kingdom between 17 and 20 September 2022, followed by Suriname and Serbia.
{| class="wikitable"
|+President Droupadi Murmu's visits by country
|-
!Number of visits
!Country
|-
|1 visit (15)
|Algeria, Angola, Botswana, Fiji, Malawi, Mauritania, Mauritius, New Zealand, Portugal, Serbia, Slovakia, Suriname, Timor-Leste, United Kingdom, Vatican City
|}
2022
{| class="wikitable outercollapse sortable"
|-
!
! Country
! Areas visited
! Date(s)
! Details
! Images
|-
! 1
|
| London
| 17–20 September 2022
| Attended state funeral of Queen Elizabeth II. First overseas visit. Held meetings with other world leaders.
|
|}
2023
{| class="wikitable outercollapse sortable"
|-
!
! Country
! Areas visited
! Date(s)
! Details
! Images
|-
! rowspan="2"| 2
|
| Paramaribo
| 4–6 June 2023
| First state visit to Suriname. Participated in Indian diaspora events. Received Grand Order Chain of the Honorary Order of the Yellow Star.
|
|-
|
|Belgrade
| 7–9 June 2023
| First Indian presidential visit to Serbia. Bilateral meeting with President Aleksandar Vučić.
|
|}
2024
{| class="wikitable outercollapse sortable"
|-
!
! Country
! Areas visited
! Date(s)
! Details
! Images
|-
! 3
|
| Port Louis
| 11 March 2024
| State visit; Chief Guest at National Day; conferred honorary doctorate.
|
|-
!colspan="6"|
|-
! rowspan="3"| 4
|
| Suva
| 5–6 August 2024
| First-ever visit by an Indian head of state to Fiji. Accorded Companion of the Order of Fiji; addressed Fijian Parliament; held delegation-level talks with President; cultural and diaspora engagement.
|
|-
|
| Auckland
| 7–9 August 2024
| Held bilateral meeting with Governor General Cindy Kiro and met Prime Minister Christopher Luxon; Address an education conference and interacted with the Indian community and friends of India.
|
|-
|
| Dili
| 10 August 2024
| First Indian presidential visit; conferred Grand Collar of the Order of Timor-Leste; MoUs on health, digital tech.
|
|-
!colspan="6"|
|-
! rowspan="3"| 5
|
| Algiers
| 13–15 October 2024
| First-ever visit by an Indian President after 39 years. Awarded honorary doctorate; held Economic Forum and delegation-level.
|
|-
|
| Nouakchott
| 16 October 2024
| First-ever presidential visit. Held bilateral talks with President; signed four MoUs on diplomatic training, cultural exchange, visa exemption and foreign office cooperation.
|
|-
|
| Lilongwe
| 17–19 October 2024
| Signed MoUs on health, youth, pharma; donated medical equipment; engaged with Indian community.
|
|}
2025
{| class="wikitable outercollapse sortable"
|-
!
! Country
! Areas visited
! Date(s)
! Details
! Images
|-
! rowspan="2"| 6
|
| Lisbon
| 7–8 April 2025
| First state visit in 27 years. Received ceremonial guard of honour; awarded City Key of Honour by Mayor of Lisbon; meetings with President Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa and PM Luis Montenegro. Cultural and diaspora engagement.
|
|-
|
| Bratislava
| 9–10 April 2025
| First visit by an Indian president to Slovakia in 29 years. Held bilateral talks with President Peter Pellegrini and Prime Minister Robert Fico. Received honorary doctorate. Two MoUs signed (on MSMEs and diplomatic training). Addressed Indian diaspora and attended cultural programs.
|
|-
!colspan="6"|
|-
! 7
|
| Vatican City
| 25–26 April 2025
| Represented India at the state funeral of Pope Francis. Laid a wreath at St. Peter’s Basilica and attended the funeral Mass with world leaders.
|
|-
!colspan="6"|
|-
! rowspan="2"| 8
|
| Luanda
| 8–11 November 2025
| First visit by and Indian president Angola, attended the 50th anniversary celebrations of Angola’s independence, addressed the National Assembly of Angola.
|
|-
|
| Gaborone
| 11–13 November 2025
| First visit by and Indian president to Botswana. Addressed the National Assembly of Botswana.
|
|}
